info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:49AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lake, northeastern Missoula and south central Flathead Counties through 530 AM MDT... At 449 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles east of St. Ignatius, or 27 miles southeast of Polson, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Condon and Salmon Prairie. This includes Highway 83 between mile markers 28 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
